body_html: @zackchase , sigmoid_cross_entropy_with_logits actually is restricted to being used with sigmoid units, in the sense that it only gives you the cross entropy if you are using such units. It is the op for binary cross entropy when the binary probability is produced by applying the sigmoid function to one argument. You could imagine other ways of getting binary probabilities, like thresholding the argument to the interval [0,1], or taking softplus(x)/(1+softplus(x)) instead of sigmoid, etc.
